textBeforeTable: Scott Kazmir Paredes, 26, pitched in the Seattle Mariners organization for seven seasons from 2005-11 and also recently completed a 24-game stint for Estrellas in the Dominican where he was 3-0 w/a 1.93 ERA (14.0IP, 8H, 3ER, 8BB, 10K, .186AVG) and limited left-handed hitters to a .174 (4-23) average. The 30-year old Gil appeared in 30 Major League games in 2004 and 2007 as a position player before being converted to the mound prior in 2008. He owns a career Minor League pitching record of 23-26 with 22 saves and a 5.63ERA in 205 games (18GS, 305.1IP, 324H, 191ER, 235K).  He spent the 2012 season in the Toronto Blue Jays system at AAA Las Vegas (7-1, 9SV, 4.92ERA) and tied for the Pacific Coast League lead with 58 relief appearances.  The Dominican Republic native recently posted a winter ball ERA of 1.52 in 24 games (8SV, 23.2IP, 19H, 4ER, .20K, .221AVG) for Estrellas in the Dominican Winter League. Kazmir, 28, owns a career Major League pitching record of 66-61 with a 4.17ERA in 179 starts with the Tampa Bay Rays and Los Angeles Angels from 2004-2011.  He was an American League All-Star in 2006 and 2008 and in 2007 he went 13-9 with a 3.48 ERA (9th-lowest in AL) in 34 starts for the Rays and led the American League in strikeouts with 239 (206.2IP).  He made 1 start for the Los Angeles Angels in April 2011
